Court rules out mandatory life sentences for juveniles

The US Supreme Court on Monday ruled that juveniles have "diminished culpability and greater prospects for reform" even when they commit terrible crimes. (Globe)
  • More than 60 cases in Mass. could be affected by ruling

Pentagon cuts due to hit Mass. hard

Massive military budget cuts are threatening the Bay State's defense spending, which has surged over the past decade, a new study predicted on Monday. (Boston Globe)

  • Lt. Gov. Murray to unveil report on Mass. military bases

State's focus is on skills for today's jobs

Massachusetts has launched a comprehensive analysis of its workforce and labor market, with the goal of better matching workers's skills to available jobs. (Boston Globe)

More than a dozen companies are expected to receive tens of millions of dollars in state or local tax breaks in exchange for promises to create nearly 1,000 jobs. (Globe)

player who will be missed
